page.title: 20Housing,Brenchley & Matfield
page.content: This is a{green belt}area and no new housing is allowed.Properties are well maintained,many being modernised and some extended.A few existing buildings like oast houses and barns have been converted to housing.A number of farm houses have been sold off separately e.g.Sandhurst.At Tong Farm (mentioned in the Domesday Book)the house now has 5 acres of garden and the surrounding orchard land belongs to a farmer from Sittingbourne. {Unemployment is exceptionally low}as the highly priced private housing is owned by the self employed or those in relatively secure executive jobs.Other properties are occupied by land owners or farm workers in tied houses.Only 20 council houses are available in the area. This survey was compiled by members of Matfield Women's Institute.
